claim: Linguistics as a scientific study began in the 19th century.
The ancient Indian scholar Panini created one of the earliest known grammars.
Ferdinand de Saussure introduced the concepts of 'langue' and 'parole'.
Noam Chomsky developed the theory of Universal Grammar.
The Neogrammarians emphasized the regularity of sound change.
The comparative method was developed to reconstruct proto-languages.
Structuralism in linguistics views language as a system of interrelated elements.
Generative grammar aims to describe the implicit knowledge of native speakers.
The term 'phoneme' was first used by American linguists.
Historical linguistics focuses on the evolution of languages over time.
Syntax deals with the structure of sentences.
Semantics is the study of meaning in language.
Pragmatics studies language use in context.
Morphology examines the internal structure of words.
Descriptive linguistics documents and describes languages as they are used.
Prescriptive grammar dictates how language should be used.
The Sapir-Whorf hypothesis proposes linguistic relativity.
Sociolinguistics studies the relationship between language and society.
Psycholinguistics explores language processing in the mind.
Computational linguistics uses algorithms to analyze language.
Dialectology studies regional language variations.
Language families are groups of related languages.
The Indo-European family includes most European and many Asian languages.
Glottochronology attempts to date language divergence.
Sign languages have their own grammar and structure.
Language acquisition research investigates how humans learn languages.
Applied linguistics addresses practical language issues, such as teaching.
Corpus linguistics analyzes large collections of real language data.
Stylistics examines variations in language use across genres.
Etymology studies the origins of words.
Creole languages develop from pidgins becoming fully developed languages.
Pidgins are simplified languages used for communication between groups.
Language death occurs when a language has no living speakers.
Bilingualism refers to fluency in two languages.
Code-switching occurs when speakers alternate between languages.
Language revitalization seeks to revive endangered languages.
Orthography is the study of writing systems.
Philology was an early form of linguistic study focused on texts.
Comparative philology was the predecessor of modern linguistics.
Transformational grammar is part of Chomsky’s linguistic theories.
The Prague School emphasized the functional aspects of language.
The Copenhagen School is associated with glossematics.
Bloomfield was a leading figure in American structural linguistics.
Saussure distinguished between synchronic and diachronic linguistics.
Chomsky criticized behaviorist views of language learning.
The study of phonetics focuses on speech sounds.
Articulatory phonetics studies how sounds are produced.
Acoustic phonetics studies the physical properties of sounds.
Auditory phonetics studies how sounds are perceived.
